豆.definition: legume; pulse; bean; pea (CL:顆|颗[ke1],粒[li4]); (old) stemmed cup or bowl

豆寇年華.definition: erroneous variant of 豆蔻年華|豆蔻年华[dou4 kou4 nian2 hua2]

豆干.definition: pressed tofu; dried tofu (ingredient of Chinese cuisine made by pressing, drying and flavoring tofu to produce a firm chewy block, typically cut into thin strips when preparing a dish)

豆汁.definition: douzhi, fermented drink made from ground mung beans; soy milk

豆渣.definition: okara (i.e. soy pulp, a by-product of making soymilk or tofu)

豆滿江.definition: Dumangang, Korean name of Tumen river 圖們江|图们江[Tu2 men2 jiang1] in Jilin province, forming the eastern border between China and North Korea

豆瓣.definition: cotyledon of a bean or pea (i.e. either of the halves of a bean or pea); thick bean sauce (abbr. for 豆瓣醬|豆瓣酱[dou4ban4jiang4])

豆腐渣.definition: okara (i.e. soy pulp, a by-product of making soymilk or tofu)

豆腐渣工程.definition: jerry-built building project; lit. built on soybean dregs

豆腐皮.definition: tofu skin (made by drying the skin that forms on the surface of soymilk during cooking, and therefore not actually made from tofu)

豆菊.definition: fried tofu skin (typically used as a hot pot ingredient)

豆蔻.definition: cardamom (Elettaria cardamomum); fig. a girl's teenage years; maidenhood; a budding beauty

豆蔻年華.definition: (of a girl) 13 or 14 years old; early teens; adolescence

豆薯.definition: yam bean (Pachyrhizus erosus), a vine with sweet edible root

豆角.definition: string bean; snap bean; green bean

豆角兒.definition: erhua variant of 豆角[dou4 jiao3]

豆豆鞋.definition: loafers (the name comes from the rubber "pebbles", which resemble beans, on the sole of some loafers)

豆雁.definition: (bird species of China) taiga bean goose (Anser fabalis)
